title: Las Olas Wine & Food Festival
address: Las Olas Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301
shortWhy: The best of Las Olas restaurants in one walkable evening.
editorialWhy: One ticket gets you tastings from dozens of Las Olas restaurants and wine vendors. Wear comfortable shoes and pace yourself—there's a lot of ground to cover.
description: Annual food and wine festival featuring tastings from Las Olas restaurants, wine vendors, and live entertainment along the boulevard.

title: Flagler Village Art Walk
shortWhy: Fort Lauderdale's answer to Wynwood, less crowded.
editorialWhy: FAT Village (Flagler Arts & Technology) has galleries, studios, and murals without Miami prices. Last Saturday of the month is when it comes alive. Good food trucks too.
description: Monthly art walk through Flagler Village galleries and artist studios. Live music, food trucks, and open studios. Free admission to all venues.

title: Fort Lauderdale Beach Yoga
shortWhy: Start your Saturday with oceanfront flow.
editorialWhy: The FTL beach is wider and less crowded than South Beach. Bring your own mat, tip the instructor what you can. Stick around for a beach walk after.
description: Free community yoga class on the beach. All levels welcome. Bring your own mat. Donations accepted.

title: Riverside Market Craft Beer Tasting
shortWhy: Legendary bottle shop with 500+ beers and regular tastings.
editorialWhy: This place is a Fort Lauderdale institution. Friday tastings introduce new arrivals. The staff actually knows beer—ask for recommendations.
description: Weekly craft beer tasting featuring new arrivals and limited releases. Knowledgeable staff and rotating food trucks outside.

title: NSU Art Museum Free Thursday
address: 1 E Las Olas Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301
shortWhy: Impressive contemporary collection, free after 4pm.
editorialWhy: The building itself is worth seeing—designed by the same architect as Denver Art Museum. Their collection of postwar American art rivals much larger cities.
description: Free admission Thursday evenings at Fort Lauderdale's premier contemporary art museum. Current exhibitions and permanent collection open.

title: Wilton Manors Stonewall Pride
shortWhy: Celebrate in one of America's most LGBTQ-friendly cities.
editorialWhy: Wilton Manors has one of the highest percentages of same-sex couples in the US. The drive shuts down for this celebration. All are welcome.
description: Street festival celebrating the LGBTQ+ community with live entertainment, vendors, food, and community organizations. Family-friendly daytime hours.

title: Hugh Taylor Birch State Park Guided Hike
address: 3109 E Sunrise Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33304
shortWhy: Rare coastal hammock forest steps from the beach.
editorialWhy: This 180-acre park is a time capsule of what Florida looked like before development. The guided hike explains the unique ecosystem. Rent kayaks for the lagoon after.
description: Ranger-led nature hike through one of Florida's last remaining coastal hammock forests. Learn about native plants and wildlife. Moderate difficulty.

title: Riverwalk Jazz Brunch
address: 305 S Andrews Ave, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301
shortWhy: Live jazz along the New River, bring your own picnic.
editorialWhy: The Riverwalk has transformed downtown FTL. Bring a blanket and grab food from nearby restaurants or pack your own. The jazz is consistently good.
description: Free live jazz performance along the Riverwalk. Local restaurants offer brunch specials. Bring blankets and chairs for the lawn.

title: Sistrunk Marketplace Food Tour
shortWhy: Food hall meets brewery in revitalized Sistrunk corridor.
editorialWhy: Named after Fort Lauderdale's historic Black business district, this food hall honors that legacy with diverse vendors. The on-site brewery makes solid lagers.
description: Food hall featuring diverse vendors, on-site brewery, and community event space. Located in the historic Sistrunk corridor.

title: Victoria Park Concert in the Park
address: 1150 G Harold Martin Dr, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33304
shortWhy: Family-friendly concert series in Fort Lauderdale's best park.
editorialWhy: Holiday Park is a hidden gem with a small amphitheater. Bring a picnic, let the kids run around. The neighborhood is quietly one of FTL's most livable.
description: Free outdoor concert series in Holiday Park. Bring lawn chairs and picnics. Family-friendly environment with playground nearby.

title: Las Olas Gallery Walk
address: 838 E Las Olas Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301
shortWhy: Fort Lauderdale's gallery row opens its doors.
editorialWhy: The Las Olas galleries tend toward the traditional but there are gems. Extended hours mean you can combine with dinner. Free parking after 6pm.
description: Monthly gallery walk along Las Olas Boulevard with participating galleries offering refreshments and new exhibition openings.

title: Lauderdale-By-The-Sea Beach Cleanup
shortWhy: Give back to the beach, then enjoy it guilt-free.
editorialWhy: LBTS is a charming beach town that feels nothing like Fort Lauderdale proper. Help keep it that way. Supplies provided, coffee after.
description: Community beach cleanup organized by local environmental group. All supplies provided. Complimentary coffee for volunteers. All ages welcome.

title: Bonnet House Museum Tour
address: 900 N Birch Rd, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33304
shortWhy: 35-acre estate frozen in Old Florida time.
editorialWhy: This artist couple's home and gardens are a window into 1920s Fort Lauderdale. The monkeys that roam the grounds are descendants of the originals. Genuinely unique.
description: Guided tour of historic estate showcasing art collection and subtropical gardens. Home to wild monkeys and diverse bird species.

title: American Social Sunday Funday
address: 721 E Las Olas Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301
shortWhy: All-day rooftop party on the river.
editorialWhy: The rooftop overlooking the New River is the draw. DJ, bottle service if you want it, but perfectly fun without. The food is better than you'd expect for this vibe.
description: Day party on the rooftop with DJ, brunch menu, and cocktail specials. Views of the New River and downtown Fort Lauderdale.

title: Broward Center Broadway Show
venueName: Broward Center for the Performing Arts
shortWhy: Broadway touring productions without driving to Miami.
editorialWhy: The Broward Center consistently books the same tours as the Arsht for less money and easier parking. Check the calendar for their Broadway series.
description: Touring Broadway production at South Florida's premier performing arts venue. Pre-show dining available at on-site restaurant.

title: Intracoastal Paddleboard Adventure
shortWhy: Paddle the Intracoastal past mega-yachts and mansions.
editorialWhy: The Fort Lauderdale Intracoastal is like a watery Rodeo Drive. Paddle past massive yachts and waterfront mansions. Rentals available, or bring your own.
description: Group paddleboard excursion on the Intracoastal Waterway. Paddle past waterfront mansions and yacht-filled marinas. Rental boards available.

title: Funky Buddha Brewery Tour
shortWhy: South Florida's most acclaimed craft brewery.
editorialWhy: Funky Buddha put Florida craft beer on the map. Their Floridian is a perfect session beer, but don't miss the specialty releases. The taproom is massive.
description: Behind-the-scenes tour of the brewery followed by guided tasting. Learn about the brewing process and Funky Buddha's history. Taproom access included.

title: Harbor Beach Sunset Sail
shortWhy: Sail out of Port Everglades at golden hour.
editorialWhy: Fort Lauderdale is the yachting capital of the world. Experience it from the water on this sunset cruise. BYOB is fine on most boats.
description: Sunset sailing cruise departing from Bahia Mar Marina. Sail past Port Everglades and along the coastline. BYOB encouraged.

title: Rio Vista House Tour
shortWhy: Tour Fort Lauderdale's most architecturally significant homes.
editorialWhy: Rio Vista is Fort Lauderdale's most beautiful neighborhood, and this annual tour opens private homes. Mediterranean Revival architecture that rivals Coral Gables.
description: Annual home tour featuring historic Rio Vista residences. Self-guided tour with docents at each home. Proceeds benefit local preservation.

title: Swap Shop Drive-In Movie
address: 3291 W Sunrise Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33311
shortWhy: One of the last drive-in theaters in Florida.
editorialWhy: The Swap Shop is gloriously weird—flea market by day, drive-in by night. It's a piece of old Florida that somehow survived. Go for the experience.
description: Double feature at one of Florida's last remaining drive-in theaters. Concession stand on site. Cash only for admission.
